text: Camblain-Châtelain is a commune in the Pas-de-Calais department in the Hauts- de-France region of France. ==Geography== Camblain-Châtelain is a farming and light industrial village some southwest of Béthune and southwest of Lille, at the junction of the D341 and the D70 roads, by the banks of the Clarence River. ==Population== ==Places of interest== * The church of St.Vaast, dating from the fifteenth century. * Ruins of an 11th-century castle. ==See also== *Communes of the Pas-de-Calais department ==References== * INSEE commune file Camblainchatelain
title: Camblain-Châtelain
